sentences.en: " You are rather disposed to call his interference officious? "
sentences.cn: “ 你认为他的干涉完全是多管闲事 吗 ? ”
一名爱发号施令的交通督导员

sentences.en: Foreign office officious ask to see the prisoner.
sentences.cn: 外交部的官员提出要见见那些囚犯.

sentences.en: He had a reputation for being politically officious and self - serving.
sentences.cn: 他因在政治上爱管闲事和个人奋斗而出名.

sentences.en: He is a harsh man, at once pompous and officious.
sentences.cn: 他是个严酷的人, 既自负又爱管闲事.

sentences.en: I moved because I can't put up with officious landlady any longer.
sentences.cn: 我搬家是因为我再也受不了那个好管闲事的女房东了.

sentences.en: If the bosses are rude or officious with customers, then employees will be, too.
sentences.cn: 如果老板对客户鲁莽无礼或说三道四, 那么雇员也会如此.

sentences.en: On the other hand, there are still many officious people.
sentences.cn: 另一方面, 还是有很多人爱多管闲事.

sentences.en: She bustles about cooking breakfast in a most officious manner.
sentences.cn: 她为准备早餐忙得团团转.

sentences.en: The consul's manner toward all tourists was officious.
sentences.cn: 这位领事对待所有的旅游者的态度都过分迁就.

sentences.en: There was pushing and pushing and officious cries.
sentences.cn: 一阵推推搡搡,再加上瞎起劲的大叫大嚷.

sentences.en: They wouldn't welcome any officious interference from the police.
sentences.cn: 他们不会欢迎任何来自警方的横加干涉。

sentences.en: We were tired of being pushed around by officious civil servants.
sentences.cn: 我们厌恶那些把我们支来支去的公务员.

sentences.en: We were tired of being pushed around by the officious guy.
sentences.cn: 我们厌烦那好管闲事的家伙把我们支来支去.

sentences.en: When people put on uniforms, their attitude becomes more confident and their manner more officious.
sentences.cn: 人们穿上制服后会信心倍增，也更爱管闲事了。

words.tran_cn: 正式地；官方地；作为公务员
使官方化；使成为正式；置在政府机关管辖下

trans.tran_cn: 过分殷勤的，爱管闲事的，爱显示权力的
trans.tran_en: too eager to tell people what to do – used to show disapproval
